page.title: 18HOUSING..cont.
page.content: Auchtermuchty is renowned for its thatched roof cottages because they are a relatively uncommon feature in Scotland. The reason for the thatching was the presence of reef beds in the River Tay which is to the north of Auchtermuchty. These reeds were suitable for use in thatching and the old traditional craft was practiced in Auchtermuchty. On the eastern side of Auchtermuchty, in our D_Block only two cottages remain thatched. The cost of re_thatching and high rates for insurance (high fire risk) are prohibitive factors in maintaining the thatch in a suitable condition.
